p: We used two different approaches to investigate compound extremes of extremely hot and dry warm seasons: (i) We counted concurrent exceedances of T over the 90th percentile (“hot”) and P below the 10th percentile (“dry”), and (ii) we modeled the dependence of T and − P with copulas and computed the bivariate return period from the fitted copula. Modeling dependence with a copula allowed us to investigate the effect of the dependence of T and P on bivariate return periods (see below).
